abstract_summ: CONCLUSIONS Hospitalized COVID-19 patients required much fewer blood transfusions than other hospitalized patients.RESULTS COVID-19 wards opened with 7 suspected patients and after 4 weeks had 305 cumulative COVID-19 admissions.METHODS Case series of Chicago COVID-19 patients aged 0-17 years reported to Chicago Department of Public Health (CDPH) from 3/5/20-4/8/20.This paper presents initial intensive-care unit (ICU) experiences with COVID-19 patients at Roskilde Hospital, which was the primary recipient of COVID-19 patients in need of intensive care in the Zealand Region, Denmark.The death rate for all hospitalized COVID-19 patients was 8.3%, and median length of hospitalization was 7.5 days.
title_summ: Coronavirus Disease-2019 in Heart Transplant Recipients in Southeastern Michigan: A Case SeriesCovid-19 in Critically Ill Patients in the Seattle Region — Case SeriesClinical Characteristics of Hospitalized Covid-19 Patients in New York CityCoronavirus disease 19 in minority populations of Newark, New JerseyCharacteristics and Outcomes of Coronavirus Disease Patients under Nonsurge Conditions, Northern California, USA, March-April 2020.A Case Series of Five People Living with HIV Hospitalized with COVID-19 in Chicago, Illinois.Characteristics of Hospitalized Pediatric COVID-19 Cases - Chicago, Illinois, March - April 2020.Blood Transfusion Utilization in Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients.Initial experiences from patients with COVID-19 on ventilatory support in Denmark.
title_abstract_phrases: METHODS Case series of Chicago COVID-19 patients aged 0-17 years reported to Chicago Department of Public Health (CDPH) from 3/5/20-4/8/20.This paper presents initial intensive-care unit (ICU) experiences with COVID-19 patients at Roskilde Hospital, which was the primary recipient of COVID-19 patients in need of intensive care in the Zealand Region, Denmark.Characteristics and Outcomes of Coronavirus Disease Patients under Nonsurge Conditions, Northern California, USA, March-April 2020.Limited data are available on the clinical presentation and outcomes of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) patients in the United States hospitalized under normal-caseload or nonsurge conditions.RESULTS COVID-19 wards opened with 7 suspected patients and after 4 weeks had 305 cumulative COVID-19 admissions.(Funded by the National Institutes of Health.)Clinical Characteristics of Hospitalized Covid-19 Patients in New York CityABSTRACT Background: The coronavirus 2019 (Covid-19) pandemic is a global public health crisis, with over 1.6 million cases and 95,000 deaths worldwide.
